title: 4 Easy and Effective Ways to Break in Your New Cornhole Bags

steps.title: Fill up your washing machine halfway.
steps.content: Fill up your washing machine halfway. Turn on your washing machine at normal speed and let it fill up with hot water. Once it’s approximately half-full, pause the cycle. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Let the cornhole bags soak with fabric softener for 2 hours.
steps.content: Let the cornhole bags soak with fabric softener for 2 hours. Pour about a cap full of fabric softener of your choosing directly into your washing machine. Then, insert the cornhole bags you wish to break in inside. Let them soak in the still water for around 2 hours. [2] X Research source After they’re done soaking, make sure to squeeze and flatten your cornhole bags to remove any excess air bubbles that may have gotten trapped inside.

steps.title: Machine-wash your cornhole bags.
steps.content: Machine-wash your cornhole bags. After 2 hours, resume washing until the machine’s cycle is complete, with cornhole bags comfortably tumbling inside. The tumbling motion should simulate the tossing of bags during a game, breaking them in even more. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Dry the cornhole bags in a dryer.
steps.content: Dry the cornhole bags in a dryer. Once the wash cycle is done, put the cornhole bags in your dryer and dry them on low heat until they’re no longer damp. Then, voila! You should have broken-in cornhole bags. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Wet your bags and massage in a bag relaxing serum.
steps.content: Wet your bags and massage in a bag relaxing serum. Dampen your cornhole bags and apply a dime-sized amount of “bag relaxing” cornhole break-in serum to each bag. Then, gently massage the serum into the bags. This serum will help loosen the fabric around each bag making them easier to toss and more likely to stick when you play your next cornhole game. [5] X Research source There are lots of different “bag relaxing” serums that can be purchased online. Brands like “Sac Relax” and “Toss Sauce” are used by most cornhole players, but see which one is right for you!

steps.title: Let your bags sit for 15-20 minutes.
steps.content: Let your bags sit for 15-20 minutes. After your "bag relaxing" serum has coated each of your cornhole bags, leave the bags still for approximately 20 minutes to let the resin sink into their material. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Soak the bags in water for 30 minutes.
steps.content: Soak the bags in water for 30 minutes. After letting the serum sit on your bags for 15 minutes, soak them in a bucket of room-temperature water for about a half-hour. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse your bags with warm water.
steps.content: Rinse your bags with warm water. After your bags have effectively soaked, thoroughly rinse each one with warm water (roughly 90 degrees) until there is no serum remaining. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Let them air dry.
steps.content: Let them air dry. Once your bags have been thoroughly rinsed, hang them vertically to let them drip and dry. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Boil your bags for 2 minutes.
steps.content: Boil your bags for 2 minutes. To make your bags looser and more receptive to the moisturizing chemicals in the conditioner, set a pot of water on your stove and let it boil. Once it begins bubbling, insert your cornhole bags and let them heat for about 2 minutes. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Transfer your bags to cool water.
steps.content: Transfer your bags to cool water. Using tongs, remove your cornhole bags and place them in a bucket or pot of cold or room-temperature water to let them cool down. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Massage your bags with conditioner.
steps.content: Massage your bags with conditioner. Apply a quarter-sized amount of paraben-free conditioner to each bag and gently massage the resin inside. Make sure to get the corners. Wring your bag out of any excess conditioner when you’re finished. [12] X Research source Like “bag relaxing” serum, hair conditioner helps relax the fabric in your cornhole bags to make them looser and easier to play with.

steps.title: Scrub your bags with soap.
steps.content: Scrub your bags with soap. Once your bags have been coated in conditioner, rinse each one off in warm water for about a minute at a time. Then, scrub the bags with Dawn or an equally powerful cleaner until the conditioner has been fully removed. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Let them air dry.
steps.content: Let them air dry. Once you’re done scrubbing your cornhole bags, place them on a drying rack and let them air out. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Just toss them.
steps.content: Just toss them. The simplest method of breaking in new cornhole bags is to just play with them. While it may take some time for them to get properly loosened, just tossing them right out of the box is an equally effective (and probably more fun) way to get your bags to your desired state. [15] X Research source
